channel.title: Bash on Datumorphism

item.title: GNUPlot
item.description: Examples Plot .csv data. Suppose we have data of such. -0.00999983, 0.99995 -0.0199987, 0.9998 -0.0299955, 0.99955 -0.0399893, 0.9992 -0.0499792, 0.99875 -0.059964, 0.998201 To plot the second column against the first column, we use the using parameter in gnuplot. gnuplot -e "set terminal png; set datafile separator ',' ; plot 'complex.txt' using 1:2" | imgcat # datafile seperator is not always necessary # imgcat is a script in iterm2 on mac
